review: Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Had severe sinus infections every six weeks X 3 episodes, treated with Augmentin 1,000/62.5 2X/D.   With fourth infection, Doctor ordered a Culture & Sensitivity & a WBC.  I suffered for 5  more days until lab returned data of positive for Serratia Mercescens, with sensitivity to Bactrim.   WBC was normal (?).  First Bactrim tab 800/160 and felt so much better.  Next AM felt almost cured with clear nasal discharge and increased energy even before second dose taken.    Way to go C & S!
It was the one drug that worked when Augmentin did not. While in the military, Augmentin was the #1 prescribed drug for Sinus issues and it never worked for me. Septra worked like a charm.
SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I use this med yearly for spring time sinus infection. Works wonderfully, for me. No side effects, ever. Probably for 5 or more years now.
Great!!!!!

Dr. prescribed for sinus infection in lieu of augmentin which I can't tolerate. Tried it for 1 day.  Took 2 pills and felt very tired and lethargic. Pressure on sinuses is worse.  Calling my Dr in the a.m. for  amoxcillin prescription which I should have asked for in first place.
Very nauseated.  Clindamycin much more effective.

40 minutes after taking 1 pill my penis began to feel very warm and the skin around the head of my penis was swelling. I called the the doctor and they said probably a fixed drug eruption. The skin around my penis swelled so bad and hurt bad and then in the morning was even worse and all the skin was peeling... My entire pubic area was sore and red. I went to the ER and the doctor there thought it also caused balantis. They did give me another kind of antibiotic but this stuff did a number on me. Also that night I took the 1 pill I felt overall like I had the flu coming on. It was horrible. I am only 3 days out from taking 1 pill and my penis swelling is a lot better but where the skin came off is really tender yet. I will never take this pill again.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):*Don’t do It!!!I was feeling ok before taking it. Heck I was running 2 miles a day before. No issues with other then my sinus being inflamed and closed. On day 2 I started getting nauseated. Day 3-4 and 6 I went to the ER. Dire pain, blood in urine. Chest pain that prevented sleeping radiating to my back. Bloating, gas, regurgitation, constipation. But worst of all I couldn’t eat. I got really weak and honestly didn’t think I was going to make it. I spent days in bed not moving due to the pain. I got a small rash day 5 on my arms. On day 6 of 14 I stopped the medication. Symptoms improve almost immediately. Still have chest pain but getting better.

Bactrim works best for my sinusitis. Augmentin never seems to help as I believe the bacteria in my sinuses have become resistant to it. I don't have any of the side effects the others speak of on here. Everyone is different. Don't make a judgment based on a review here.

Bactrim seems to be the only antibiotic that works for me. If I get a sinus infection, Bactrim  works wonders. I don’t have side effects, except loss of appetite sometimes. I am now using it as a preventative medicine due to allergies. With everything shut down due to COVID-19, I could not get my allergy shots.  This medicine has kept me from getting sick

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I took this as my 3rd round of antibiotics for Sinusitis. After taking bactrim for 4 days l have been having horrible hives and rashes. I am literally wanting to itch my skin off its so bad. Took 2 Benadryl and l have stopped taking this rubbish. Definitely calling my doctor about these horrible  side effects.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):If you are talking bactrim, you need to be on probiotics so you don't get cramps and nausea. It works

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Very slow results or sinusitis. Day 5 I was slightly improved, productive cough. Day 10 my green gunk had just disappeared, still coughing and clear phlegm. Day 11 green came back. Went and got a z pack. Already feel better the same day.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I’m currently taking Bactrim twice a day for a sinus infection. I've taken it before for the same thing and I seem to recall its just about the ONLY antibiotic that doesn’t feel like it’s is really bad for me in the process!  I’m also taking a steroid pak at the same time. Don’t be afraid to take it; everyone’s body reacts differently.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Bactrim for yearly sinus infection related to fall allergies works every time.  Three days and inflammation and pressure subsiding.  Yes some nausea and need to follow up for yeast afterwards.  Drink lots of water.  Best antibiotic for me since I’m allergic to penicillin and it’s relatives.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I had been on  Bactrim 800/160 mg. 2 x's a day sinus infection included smelling something burnt everywhere I went it was the same smell plus ears felt congested and I couldn't hear well,e yes were watering glands in neck were swelled started healing in 2 days, but cramping started so went to E.R. They admitted me overnight with IV fluids helped some but not a whole lot, then was changed to clindamyacin. In a few days I smelt the burnt smell coming back as well as the ear congestion and cramping never really subsided.  I called pharmacy got reacted magnesium for cramping it helped and that night and slept like a log so I thought I would try and start the bactrim again.  Well I took it before I went to bed the next day I felt cramping coming back again so I took 2  magnesium read that it has to be 4 hours apart to take meds after magnesium while Im waiting for for magnesium to work cramping didn't seem to wanna subside now I have to go back to doctor and explain all this

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was given Bactrim DS for an ear and sinus infection. I had never been given this antibiotic, but have also never had issues with any antibiotic, so I didn’t have any concerns. I ate dinner then immediately took my first pill. Within 2 hours of taking it I could visibly see the bloating in my stomach with some mild stomach discomfort. 2 hours after that the severe nausea sat in. The nausea was HORRIBLE!! Then the diarrhea started, which was awful. I did throw up one time, but I think that was induced by drinking too much water. I was afraid I was going to dehydrate. I also experience terrible heart palpitations & weakness. The terrible side effects only lasted about 6hrs. I’m a little over 24 hrs from all this & I feel much better, but stomach still isn’t right & just have an overall feeling of weakness. The dr told me to immediately stop the antibiotic, which was the only option for me. She said it sounded like I had a sulphate intolerance.
Excellent medecine. No side effects at all.I have taken augmentin and it only works on a limited number of bacteria.This anti biotic is the best on the market for sinus infections

For me, this medication is an absolute nightmareI  After about 8 days in this med, I started feeling intense muscle cramping, fever and chills. So I stopped taking it. To my surprise, Bactrim can have horrible side effects, which I experienced every one of them. I had a 101 degree fever, chills, skin rash, heart palpitations, aches and pains beyond what any human should suffer, for 5 days afterwards. I thought I was going to have a heart attack and that would be it for me . When my body told me to sleep, I slept. And I did a lot of sleeping because I knew that my body seriously needed the rest to try and repair itself from all of the side effects I stated. It took my 10 full days to even fell semi-normal again. If the rating system would allow, I would give this drug a negative 10 for being so destructive.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):A lot of people mentioning vomiting and nausea. Be aware that you cannot drink ANY alcohol while on Bactrim. It can make you vomit or cause nausea. It’s very effective for certain UTIs depending on the strain of bacteria. Told this by my pharmacist and doctor. Unsure about sinus but I’m trying that now.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Developed sinusitis with heavy pressure in ears, drainage, swollen throat/glands, etc  Prescribed Badtrim-DS for seven day course, twice daily. Within 12 hours swelling was nearly gone, pain reduced to minimal. Did experience restlessness, sleeplessness, and some dehydration despite drinking a lot of water. Seems like it dealt with the infection itself, but still dealt with sinus problems ( drainage, congestion in ears, and coughing due to drainage) for several days after. **Bactrim is a Sulfa- product, so doc made sure I wasn't allergic before prescribing.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This is HORRIBLE medication! I was on Bactrim for only 3 days for sinusitis, then on day 4 I had hives and my face was BURNING from the inside out but no fever. Went off it. Then day 5,6 and on 7 now and my jaw aches  and my face feels like it’s going to implode. Strangest feeling. I’m dizzy have a headache but the facial tightening and burning is making me crazy. This stuff is scary and have no idea when it’s going to stop. Never again

The first 1 I took I could tell a small change as if were starting to work already so naturally I took my 2nd pill last night. I had muscle twitching and couldn't sleep due to light anxiety waves I kept having. I had a feeling, but didn't pay attention to my gut that it was the culprit. I paid dearly for it this morning as my anxiety level was like I've never had before. Brain felt fried and very jittery!

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Like many others, I read review after review on here of negative experiences, making myself terrified of taking this drug. As someone who is so worried about throwing up that I carry anti-nausea medication with me everywhere I go, I was very reluctant to begin 6 weeks of Bactrim after reading all of these reviews.Fortunately, I experienced no major side effects and it seems to be helping with the infection. Some very mild nausea at first that was likely anxiety-induced, and acid reflux which is common with all antibiotics. Yogurt and a probiotic daily helps with this.Anyway, I promised myself that I would write a positive review if I ended up having a positive experience, so here it is. If you're worried like I was, remember that people are way more inclined to post drug reviews online when they have negative experiences, than normal or positive ones. The vast majority of people taking Bactrim feel absolutely fine, and keeping this in mind may help ease your fears as well.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I literally took 3 pills and had to stop. I was worried it was a stomach virus but nope it was Bactrim. I’m not sensitive to antibiotics but this was horrible. I threw up and felt nauseous about 12 hours after the third pill.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I just wanted to pop in and say Bactrim is a Sulpha drug. A lot of people are allergic to Sulpha and some are allergic to the trimethoprim part as well. Those of you having a reaction, this is probably why. You also need to tell your Dr you're allergic to Sulpha drugs or trimethoprim so they don't prescribe you any! Be well!
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Hope I'm not responding prematurely, but I feel improvement within 24 hours.  Still have 12 days to go.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Don’t believe  everything you read here.  I took this drug for a sinus infection I developed on a plane coming from overseas. Within four hours  I started feeling better. Took about five days until I  felt completely well. When I went to see the doctor, I had a temperature of 100.3 and felt bad. This drug may not be for everyone but it worked for me. No side effects.

I start by putting a half of a sulfa DS into a Nette Pot, saline and warm distilled water. Go slow with it, hold it in my nose as long as I can. Then I take 2 a day for 7 to 10 days, if there’s nothing in your environment recreating the problem, it goes away.  I do think Augmentin 860/125 id still the best . Best thing to do is avoid dust, pollutants and keep your house super clean- I have times where I can go 6 to 10 months no antibiotics— but they are the only thing that works.  In 2008 my ENT gave me a trial nasal mist with Cipro in it, used 2x a day for 4 days, nasal infection done for a yr, I went to refill it,,  manufacturer removed it- why, because it worked—- I do use steam machines twice daily as well- distilled water, it helps, I have remedies- feel free to reach out

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I have a severe sinus infection that been lasting on and off for months.  Dr put me on Bactrum for 15 days.  I'm on day 12 with zero improvement.  Actually I'm worse.  No voice, face hurts, throat swollen, glands swollen.  I feel the pill isn't do anything at all.

I feel like I am going insane. I want to crawl out of my skin. I feel restless all over inside of my body. I am stopping this now. It's giving me panic attacks and my heart keeps pounding through my chest. I'm scared I will end up in the hospital. I can't stop twitching and drinking tons of water.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I took bactrim ds twice a day for 10 days for a stubborn sinus infection. On day 6 I started to get chills, cold hands and feet then the crippling body aches and pains started. Even my buttocks is painful! I also became very weak! It's been 2 weeks since I've finished the bactrim and I am STILL in excruciating pain everywhere,  back, legs, arms, buttocks and very weak. I WILL NEVER TAKE THIS AGAIN! I hope this goes away soon and it's not permanent damage to my body.  Everyday is a struggle because of the terrible aches and pains. This drug should be BANNED!

Very surprised at the negative reviews. I haven't used in years but about to for persistent sinusitis. I've always found it effective with no side effects, and  never caused a vaginal yeast infection as many other drugs have. My guess is those reporting bad side effects are intolerant of sulfa... I'm not but my ex was/is.
One pill in I felt dizzy, my skin was crawling and on fire. Second pill in I had headache, nauseous, no sleep, night sweats. Constant panicky feeling. Pill is going back on my no thank you list.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This worked fine. I have no side effects. The people above seem to have an allergic reaction to this medication. Obviously stop taking it. You don't need a Dr to tell you that.

I have a very stubborn sinus infection. I have had 2 rounds of a z-pac, biaxin xl, Augmentin, and no success whatsoever. I'm currently on day 3 of Bactrim DS, and I'm also taking a probiotic, as well as a b complex vitamin with vit. c. in this short time, I am feeling so much better. No side effects at all, not one complaint. I am so happy to be on this, it's actually working for me!!!
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):this drug is EVIL!!!! stay away from it.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I recently took Bactrim for a sinus infection. My first day of taking the bactrim. I got nervous  and my hands started to itch I couldn't sit still. I broke out in a red rash on shoulder and left hand and my feet is red and both sides. But I had previously took bactrim before over the years with no problems. And this time I was shocked because I had taken it before. So I went to the Urgent Care and they told me not to take it any more. So I am throwing the cheap in the trash. And I just hope that my sinus will heal on its own.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):It did help the sinusitis.  The side effects were awful.  Yeast infection that took 6 pills of diflucan to get rid of.  I had blisters.. most about 2" to 3" in circumference on my legs thighs and back.  It took a while for them to heal too. My joints ached. Definitely on my never to take again list.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I've been plagued with UTI's my entire adult life and Bactrim was my go to drug. I got a sinus infection 2 weeks ago and Dr said take Bactrim. My tongue swelled up and sores developed on it, that was AWFUL! I've never had any reaction before. I'm really disappointed because it's always been my go to.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I have had a severe reaction to Bactrim multiple times and only just recently put it together. According to my doctor, Bactrim has a super rare side effect in which it can cause drug-induced meningitis. I was prescribed Bactrim last month for a sinus infection and after a single dose was extremely ill and ended up hospitalized with viral meningitis. My intracranial pressure that was read with the spinal tap was 62 and normal readings are under 20.  This was the third time I have taken Bactrim and the reactions increased in severity with each incident.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was recently prescribed Bactrim DS for my chronic sinusitis  by my ENT. I informed her that I had been prescribed Bactrim in the past, although I did not inform her that it was lesser strength of the two  and after eight and a half days of taking two a day I finally had to stop due to the side effects that were occurring. I took the first dosage and felt fatigued and slightly itchy. I reminded myself tho that when I am overtired and restless that I tend to feel itchy so I took a shower and and slept for a while and I was fine. The following few days I had no problems besides light bloating and fatigue. I kept taking my medication as prescribed and after the fifth day I was having radiating pain around the left and right side of my sternum

Septra DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was diagnosed with a sinus infection and prescribed Septa. Instructions stated to take the medication for 14 days. On the 12th day, I noticed a rash on my ankle. By that evening I was running fever. At 3:30 am I woke up with blood on my face - my lips had swollen so much that they had split. My eyes, feet, hands, gums and roof of my mouth were also swollen. My temperature went to 105 and I was hospitalized. The diagnosis was that I am allergic to sulfa drugs. I was in hospital for a week and it took me over six weeks before I was near normal.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was prescribed this medication for ten days after two recent bouts with a sinus infection that never seemed to clear. This did the trick. I was thirsty and somewhat restless but had none of the major possible side effects that the doctor warned me about.

My first time on this medication, so far I'm not impressed. I'm on day 3 right now for a sinus infection and I still feel basically the same as I did the day I went in to see the dr, only my throat is incredibly MORE sore and I'm coughing when I wasn't before. Having trouble sleeping and I have no appetite. Hopefully I will see some improvement in the next day or two.

I've had sinusitis for 9 months. Tried to treat it with natural remedies but it finally affected my lungs causing severe chest infection. I've been taking trimethoprim 400mg twice a day for 3 days and I can say that I am feeling much better. No major side effects apart from nausea bit eating small amounts of food at regular intervals is helping. No upset stomach or stomach pains which surprised me due to having IBS. Anyone suffering side effects always remember that any antibiotic will cause you to feel unwell. You have to persevere with it and they will ease. Failure to compete the course of medication will result in the infection coming back.
SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Severe diarrhea, severe nausea and vomiting after 2 doses.

I had a sinus infection 20 years ago that spread to my left eye & left frontal lobe of my brain. I had surgery on my sinuses, left eye, and my left temporal lobe of my brain removed and now have a plastic plate on the left side of my head. So I have frequent sinus infections and headaches. I was given generic Bactrim  from the VA. I have taken it 2 days and my sinuses have cleared up any.So I am still having headaches but now have nausea, and diarrhea and stomach pains. I just hope it gets rid of the infection.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Taking 2 pills twice a day everyday something new for a side effect , great way to loose weight . Don't feel like eating at all I do is keep my self hydrated with fluids to thin the phlegm so I can cough it loose and get the rest out of my system. Can't wait till I can stop taking it . Also think it's shredding my red blood cells feel tired and sometimes dizzy and weak

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Yeah, did this for seven days. Just got out of the hospital after a full body rash (including feet, hands a face, required them to put me on iv antibiotics for two days). Fun times

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I suffer from frequent severe migraines and disclosed this info to the physician during my visit. Recent sinus infections I took a Z-pack and was done but this time was my first time taking Bactrim - DS. Painful headaches, stomach aches, constipation even after drinking water frequently daily. Hoping I don't get the yeast infection or any other issues some patients complain about.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Started meds on Monday.  My arms and legs hurt terribly Tuesday and Wednesday.  The headache has been the worst I have ever had.  Chills, sweating, nausea, impaired vision, insomnia.  I called the Dr's office Wednesday afternoon and the nurse told me to give it a few more days. Went to different Dr on Saturday and he said bactrim is notorious for headaches and other adverse effects. Off of it now and have to wait 24 hours before I can start a new antibiotic.  I'm praying this headache ends soon

I was prescribed this medication for a sinus/ear infection. Within a few days of taking it I could finally breathe and begin to hear again. But I had also developed severe nausea, migraines, and loss of appetite. I have also suffered bouts of extreme fatigue and dizziness that have led to me nearly passing out. And on top of all that I broke out in an awful red, itchy rash all over my chest, neck, and face. This medication is terrible. I have never reacted to anything this way.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):At first, I found myself with more energy and simply lost my appetite, which didn't bother me.Then, the second day, I suffered nausea and vomiting. I discontinued the medicine on the second day, but the nausea and vomiting continue.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Took medication with the warning that it needed to be taken with "plenty of water". Woke up in the middle of the night with a severe headache and went back to sleep. Woke up in the morning for work and had debilitating nausea. I really hope this is just a temporary thing and I don't have to do this every time i take it.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I took this for four and a half days. I experienced complete appetite loss, nausea, fatigue, abdominal pain, and anxiety.  I had blood work done before I took the Bactrim and when I got my results back it turned out I didn't have a bacterial infection at all. All that for nothing. I still haven't completely recovered my appetite and it has been almost a week since my last dose.
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):The pressure in my head is gone but I have been getting extreme nausea and fatigue since I started it 5 days ago.
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Usually clears up any infections but does sometimes cause extreme nausea and yeast infection.

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Taking this for sinusitis.  I am an adilt taking in suspension, as I have trouble swallowing pills.  It says grape and is purple in color but it tastes terrible.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):My body responds to sulfur products. After two days on Bactrim I noticed a difference. By the 4th day I was back to myself. It really helped me.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I have been taking Bactrim for sinusitis around a week. I have developed painful sores on my tongue that are not visible to the eye. My mouth itches and burns terribly. It worked for my underlining condition but this side effect is unbearable.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I've been on it for 6 days now and I feel the same as I did before.  This is my first time taking it for a sinus infection.  I guess it doesn't work for me.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Took one dose of Bactrim for sinusitis/bronchitis and 3 hours later face was red. 1 hour following, my face, arms and hands broke out into hives. Had to discontinue and call doc.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I took Bactrim DS after the first antibiotic didn't work on my sinus infection. I started to feel better after 4 days, however I developed joint pain in my hands and knees. I have arthritis from an autoimmune disease, but it's usually controlled very well by a maintenance medicine. On day 8 I noted lots of swollen glands in my neck and a slight temp. After I took my antibiotic that night my fever shot up to 103, I was shaking, teeth chattering, with severe joint/muscle pain, my face looked sunburned, and my body was red/blotchy. I stopped the Bactrim, but the fever lasted 2-3 days, the arthritis was severe for about a week and I still have fatigue. Good news is ENT did recheck and infection is gone.

I currently have an inner ear blockage from blowing my nose too hard. I have been on Sulfamethoxazole for 5 days. Still have the blockage and mucky junk in my nose. Doesn't seem to have done anything so far.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Great antibiotic, cleared away my sinusitis, however been an insomniac for the past couple of days.
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):It always gets the job done soon when you first start taking the medication.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was given the generic Bactrim for a sinus infection. After 4 days, I couldn't stop vomiting and having diarrhea for 3 days.  Almost went to the hospital.  It seemed to be making me feel better until the side effects kicked in.  I had to stop the medication.

Used this for sinusitis, cleared it within 36 hours. No side effects noted at all. Took the full course with no problems.  Have used this drug for Strep as well and it worked well with no side effects.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Was prescribed Bactrim for combination of sinusitis and a urinary tract infection. After two pills I got a yeast infection. Not sure the medication is working to make me feel better or not.
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Works okay after a couple of days with no side efects, but everybody is different.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Horrible headache and stomach ache. Had to discontinue.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):After three days of perscribed use of the generic bactrim, my headaches and nasal discharge have decrease dramatically. Side Effects, insomnia (reason I am writing this review), pain in jaw and throat if not taken with ample water.
